keyword: how many calories in 2 fried eggs
title: How Many Calories Are in 2 Fried Eggs?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in 2 fried eggs, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and simple tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories Are in 2 Fried Eggs?
assumptions: Large eggs (~50 g each), fried sunny-side up in 1 tsp oil total, no added salt.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, frying method, oil type/amount, and seasonings. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: Two large fried eggs contain ~184 kcal and ~13 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Fried in non-stick pan with no added oil
Over-easy with extra yolk runniness (minimal change)

faqs.q: How many calories in one fried egg?
faqs.a: About 92 kcal for one large fried egg.

faqs.q: What's the protein in 2 fried eggs?
Do fried eggs have more calories than boiled?
faqs.a: Yes, due to added oil or butter; fried adds ~14-20 kcal per egg over boiled.

faqs.q: How much fat is in 2 fried eggs?
faqs.a: Around 14 g total fat, including 4 g saturated.

faqs.q: Does frying method affect calories in eggs?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”deep-fried or extra oil increases calories; non-stick reduces them.
